text: Local boards of health were the first public health organisations in England and Wales. They were set up under the Public Health Act 1848 after cholera epidemics had killed a lot of people in cities. They had the power to control sewers, clean the streets, and manage other health risks including slaughterhouses and supply clean water to their districts. ==References== Category:Public health Category:Health in the United Kingdom Category:1848 establishments in England
title: Local board of health
